'Mendocino County' is a county located on the north coast of the U.S. state of
California, north of the greater San Francisco Bay Area and west of the Central
Valley. As of the 2010 census, the population was 87,841, up from 86,265 at the
2000 census. The county seat is Ukiah.

The county is noted for its distinctive Pacific Ocean coastline, Redwood
forests, wine production, microbrews, and liberal views about the use of
cannabis and support for its legalization. It is estimated that roughly one-
third of the economy is based on the cultivation of marijuana. {{cite video
 | people = Regan, Trish title = Marijuana Inc., Inside America's Pot Industry
 | url = http://www.cnbc.com/id/28281668 accessdate=2009-03-15 medium =
 | televised documentary publisher = CNBC, Incorporated location = Mendocino
 | County, California, USA
 |date = 2009-01-23}}

The notable historic and recreational attraction of the "Skunk Train" connects
Fort Bragg with Willits in Mendocino County via steam-locomotive trains and
other vehicles. The Skunk Train's normal route is not in full operation due to a
collapsed tunnel, the local community is working on raising the money to fix the
tunnel, as of June 2013.
